Award.AwardTitle: COACh Workshop for Women in Combustion

Division.LongName: Div Of Chem, Bioeng, Env, & Transp Sys

Award.AbstractNarration:
1360950
Ellzey, Janet L.

The requested funding is for a leadership workshop for women scientists in the field of combustion to be held at the site of the International Symposium on Combustion in San Francisco, CA on Saturday, August 2, 2014, the day before the Symposium begins. The workshop is based on COACh, an NSF-funded program, to develop leadership workshops for women in science. The goal of the workshop is to provide networking opportunities and leadership skills to both junior and senior women researchers in the field of combustion.

POR.DRECONTENT:
The Combustion Institute is the primary national and international organization for industry and academic researchers in the field of combustion.  The members are generally aerospace or mechanical engineers and, consequently, the field is very male-dominated.  The 34th International Symposium on Combustion held in Warsaw Poland in 2012 had almmost 1300 participants with only approximately 179 (14%) women.  The Combustion Institute is committed to encouraging diversity in its membership and has supported the organization of Women in Combustion.  With this goal in mind, the Combustion Institute partnered with NSF to fund a COACh workshop, an NSF-funded program to develop leadership training for women in science.  This workshop was held in San Francisco on 2 August 2014, the day before the International Symposium on Combustion to faciliate the participation in the workshop by women attending the symposium. The workshop was attended by 11 women graduate students, from both the U.S. and international institutions. The sessions were lead by professional COACH facilitators and additional advice was provided by two senior female faculty members. Professional development sessions focused on negotiation, communication and job skills.  Evaluations at the end of the workshop indicated that the participants found the workshop useful in helping to develop these skills.


Last Modified: 07/20/2015
Modified by: Janet L Ellzey

With this goal in mind, the Combustion Institute partnered with NSF to fund a COACh workshop, an NSF-funded program to develop leadership training for women in science. This workshop was held in San Francisco on 2 August 2014, the day before the International Symposium on Combustion to faciliate the participation in the workshop by women attending the symposium. The workshop was attended by 11 women graduate students, from both the U.S. and international institutions. The sessions were lead by professional COACH facilitators and additional advice was provided by two senior female faculty members.
